SEARCH
Package org.opencastproject.util

Class MimeType

java.lang.Object
org.opencastproject.util.MimeType
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<MimeType>
public final class MimeType extends Object implements Comparable<MimeType>, Serializable
This class implements the mime type. Note that mime types should not be instantiated directly but be retreived from the mime type registry MimeTypes.
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • mimeType

      public static MimeType mimeType(String type, String subtype, List<String> suffixes, List<MimeType> equivalents, Option<String> description, Option<String> flavor, Option<String> flavorDescription)

    • mimeType

      public static MimeType mimeType(String type, String subtype, String suffix)

    • mimeType

      public static MimeType mimeType(String type, String subtype)

    • getType

      public String getType()
      Returns the major type of this mimetype.

      For example, if the mimetype is ISO Motion JPEG 2000 which is represented as video/mj2, this method will return video.

      Returns:
      the type

    • getSubtype

      public String getSubtype()
      Returns the minor type of this mimetype.

      For example, if the mimetype is ISO Motion JPEG 2000 which is represented as video/mj2, this method will return mj2.

      Returns:
      the subtype

    • getSuffix

      public Option<String> getSuffix()
      Returns the main suffix for this mime type, that identifies files containing data of this flavor.

      For example, files with the suffix mj2 will contain data of type video/mj2.

      Returns:
      the file suffix

    • getSuffixes

      public String[] getSuffixes()
      Returns the registered suffixes for this mime type, that identify files containing data of this flavor. Note that the list includes the main suffix returned by getSuffix().

      For example, files containing ISO Motion JPEG 2000 may have file suffixes mj2 and mjp2.

      Returns:
      the registered file suffixes

    • supportsSuffix

      public boolean supportsSuffix(String suffix)
      Returns true if the mimetype supports the specified suffix.
      Returns:
      true if the suffix is supported

    • getDescription

      public Option<String> getDescription()
      Returns the mime type description.
      Returns:
      the description

    • getFlavor

      public Option<String> getFlavor()
      Returns the flavor of this mime type.

      A flavor is a hint on a specialized variant of a general mime type. For example, a dublin core file will have a mime type of text/xml. Adding a flavor of mpeg-7 gives an additional hint on the file contents.

      Returns:
      the file's flavor

    • getFlavorDescription

      public Option<String> getFlavorDescription()
      Returns the flavor description.
      Returns:
      the flavor description

    • hasFlavor

      public boolean hasFlavor(String flavor)
      Returns true if the file has the given flavor associated.
      Returns:
      true if the file has that flavor

    • asString

      public String asString()
      Deprecated.
      use toString() instead
      Returns the MimeType as a string of the form type/subtype

    • eq

      public boolean eq(MimeType other)
      Two mime types are considered equal if type and subtype are equal.

    • eq

      public boolean eq(String type, String subtype)
      Two mime types are considered equal if type and subtype are equal.

    • isEquivalentTo

      public boolean isEquivalentTo(String type, String subtype)
      Returns true if this mime type is an equivalent for the specified type and subtype.

      For example, a gzipped file may have both of these mime types defined, application/x-compressed or application/x-gzip.

      Returns:
      true if this mime type is equal
